title: Falafel Salad with Lemon-Tahini Dressing
ingredients:
- 1 cup dried chickpeas
- 2 cups packed flat-leaf parsley, divided
- 1/4 cup chopped red onion plus 1/4 cup thinly sliced, divided
- 2 cloves garlic
- 5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided
- 3 tablespoons lemon juice, divided
- 1 tablespoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon salt, divided
- 5 tablespoons tahini
- 5 tablespoons warm water
- 6 cups sliced romaine lettuce
- 2 cups sliced cucumbers and/or radishes
- 1 pint grape tomatoes, quartered
instructions:
1. Soak chickpeas in cold water for 12 to 24 hours.
2. Drain the 1 cup of chickpeas and transfer to a food processor.
3. Add 1 cup parsley, 1/4 cup chopped onion, 2 garlic cloves, 1 tablespoon oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 tablespoon cumin and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
4. Process until finely and evenly ground.
5. Shape into 12 patties (1 1/2 inches wide), using a generous 2 tablespoons each.
6. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
7. Reduce heat to medium.
8. Cook the falafel until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes.
9. Turn, swirl in 1 tablespoon oil and cook until golden on the other side, 3 to 5 minutes more.
10. Meanwhile, whisk 5 tablespoons tahini, 5 tablespoons water and the remaining 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 tablespoon oil and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large bowl.
11. Transfer 1/4 cup to a small bowl.
12. Add 6 cups romaine and the remaining 1 cup parsley to the large bowl and toss to coat.
13. Top with 2 cups sliced cucumbers and/or radishes, 1 pint tomatoes, the sliced onion and the falafel.
14. Drizzle with the reserved 1/4 cup dressing.

title: Chicken Shawarma with Potatoes
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper
- 12 ounces Yukon Gold potatoes (2 medium), peeled and cut into 1/2-inch chunks
- 1 medium red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 12 ounces boneless, skinless chicken thighs, trimmed
- Chopped fresh parsley or chives for garnish
instructions:
1. Combine lemon juice, 1 Tbsp. oil, garlic, cumin, salt, cinnamon, turmeric, and pepper in a medium bowl.
2. Transfer half the mixture to another medium bowl.
3. Add potatoes, bell pepper, and onion to one bowl; toss to coat.
4. Add chicken to the second bowl; toss to coat.
5. Cover both bowls and let marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
6. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
7. Line a baking sheet with foil or parchment paper and drizzle with the remaining 1 Tbsp. oil.
8. With a slotted spoon, transfer the vegetable mixture and the chicken to the prepared baking sheet (discard the marinade).
9. Roast, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender and lightly browned at the edges, 25 to 28 minutes. (Refrigerate half the chicken and half the vegetable mixture for another use; see Associated Recipes.)
10. Garnish with parsley (or chives), if desired.

title: Tabbouleh
ingredients:
- 4 parsley medium size bouquets
- 1 small onion
- 2 tomatos
- 1 table spoons of salt
- 2 tea spoons pepper
- pinch of cinnamon
- pinch of black pepper
- 3/4 cup bulgur wheat
- 1 1/2 lemon juice
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- basil to garnish
instructions:
1. Combine lemon juice, olive oil, salt, cinnamon, pepper.
2. Finely mince the parsley, onion and tomatoes.
3. Mix all in large bowl with bulgur.

title: Avocado & Smoked Salmon Omelet
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper
- 12 ounces Yukon Gold potatoes (2 medium), peeled and cut into 1/2-inch chunks
- 1 medium red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 12 ounces boneless, skinless chicken thighs, trimmed
- Chopped fresh parsley or chives for garnish
instructions:
1. Beat eggs with milk and salt in a small bowl.
2. Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a small nonstick skillet over medium heat.
3. Add the egg mixture and cook until the bottom is set and the centre is still a bit runny, 1 to 2 minutes.
4. Flip the omelet over and cook until set, about 30 seconds more.
5. Transfer to a plate.
6. Top with avocado, salmon and basil.
7. Drizzle with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon oil.

title: Garlic Butter-Roasted Salmon with Potatoes & Asparagus
ingredients:
- 1 pound baby Yukon Gold potatoes, halved
- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided
- 3/4 teaspoon salt, divided
- 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper, divided
- 12 ounces asparagus, trimmed
- 2 tablespoons melted butter
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 1/4 pounds salmon fillet, skinned and cut into 4 portions
- 4 tablespoons chopped parsley for garnish
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 F.
2. Toss 1 pound of potatoes, 1 tablespoon oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper together in a medium bowl.
3. Spread in an even layer on a large rimmed baking sheet.
4. Roast until starting to soften and brown, about 15 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, toss 12 ounces of asparagus with the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, 1/8 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper in the medium bowl.
6. Combine 2 tablespoons butter, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, garlic, 1/4 teaspoon salt and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl.
7. Sprinkle 1 1/4 pound salmon with the remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt.
8. Move the potatoes to one side of the pan.
9. Place the salmon in the centre of the pan; drizzle with the butter mixture.
10. Spread the asparagus on the empty side of the pan.
11. Roast until the salmon is just cooked through and the vegetables are tender, 10 to 12 minutes.
12. Garnish with parsley.

title: Chickpea-Eggplant Bowls with Tahini
ingredients:
- 1 (16.3-ounce) jar roasted red peppers, drained
- 1 cup chopped toasted walnuts, divided
- 5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided
- 3 tablespoons lemon juice, divided
- 1 tablespoon no-salt-added tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon Sriracha
- 2 medium cloves garlic, grated, divided
- 3/4 teaspoon smoked paprika, divided
- 1/2 teaspoon salt plus 1/8 teaspoon, divided
- 2 small eggplants (about 12 ounces each), unpeeled, cubed (1-inch)
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper
- 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
- 1 (15-ounce) can no-salt-added chickpeas, rinsed
- 3 cups loosely packed arugula
- 3 tablespoons tahini
- 3 tablespoons warm water
- 1/4 cup drained pickled red onions
instructions:
1. Place a large rimmed baking sheet on centre oven rack; preheat to 475 F.
2. Combine drained roasted peppers, 3/4 cup walnuts, 1 tablespoon oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 tablespoon tomato paste, 1 teaspoon Sriracha, half the grated garlic, 1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a food processor.
3. Process until smooth, about 1 minute, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed.
4. Transfer to a medium bowl, cover and refrigerate.
5. Toss cubed eggplant with 1/2 teaspoon coriander, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika in a large bowl.
6. Spread in an even layer on the preheated baking sheet. (Reserve the bowl for later use; do not wipe clean.)
7. Roast until tender and browned, about 15 minutes, flipping once.
8. Without removing the pan, switch oven to broil; broil until lightly charred in spots, 4 to 5 minutes.
9. Remove from oven.
10. Meanwhile, whisk 1 teaspoon mustard, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and the remaining 1 tablespoon oil in the reserved large bowl.
11. Add rinsed chickpeas and 3 cups arugula; toss gently to coat.
12. In a small bowl, combine 3 tablespoons tahini, 3 tablespoons warm water and the remaining 1 tablespoon lemon juice, grated garlic and 1/8 teaspoon salt; whisk until smooth.
13. To assemble, spoon about 1/3 cup red pepper sauce into each of 4 shallow bowls; spread with the back of a spoon.
14. Top with the roasted eggplant and the chickpea-arugula mixture.
15. Drizzle with tahini sauce (about 1 1/2 tablespoons each) and top with 1/4 cup pickled red onions and the remaining 1/4 cup walnuts.

title: Sweet Potato-Black Bean Burgers
ingredients:
- 2 cups grated sweet potato
- 1/2 cup old-fashioned rolled oats
- 1 cup no-salt-added black beans, rinsed
- 1/2 cup chopped scallions
- 1/4 cup vegan mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon no-salt-added tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon curry powder
- 1/8 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup plain unsweetened almond milk yogurt
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 4 whole-wheat hamburger buns, toasted
- 1 cup thinly sliced cucumber
instructions:
1. Squeeze grated sweet potato with paper towels to remove excess moisture; place in a large bowl.
2. Pulse oats in a food processor until finely ground; add to the bowl with the sweet potatoes.
3. Add beans, scallions, mayonnaise, tomato paste, curry powder and salt to the bowl; mash the mixture together with your hands.
4. Shape into four 1/2-inch-thick patties.
5. Place the patties on a plate; refrigerate for 30 minutes.
6. Stir yogurt, dill and lemon juice together in a small bowl; set aside.
7. Heat oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat.
8. Add the patties; cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
9. Divide the yogurt sauce evenly among top and bottom bun halves.
10. Top each bottom bun half with a burger and cucumber slices; replace top bun halves.

title: The Best Vegetarian Tacos
ingredients:
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 5 cups chopped root vegetables (such as carrot, sweet potatoes, parsnips, winter squash, delicata squash, turnip and/or rutabaga, peeled if necessary)
- 1 medium red onion, sliced into 1/2-inch wedges
- 2 tablespoons neutral oil, such as canola or avocado
- 10 (6 inch) corn tortillas, warmed
- 2/3 cup crumbled queso fresco or cotija cheese
- 2/3 cup finely shredded cabbage
- 1/3 cup sour cream
- Lime wedges for serving (optional)
instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 F.
2. Stir garlic powder, cumin, paprika, coriander and salt together in a small bowl until combined.
3. Spread root vegetables and red onion in a single layer on a large rimmed baking sheet.
4. Drizzle with oil; toss to coat.
5. Sprinkle the reserved spice mixture evenly over the vegetables.
6. Roast, stirring once halfway, until the vegetables are tender, 40 to 45 minutes.
7. Remove from oven; stir gently.
8. Fill each tortilla with 1/3 cup vegetables and 1 tablespoon pickles; top with cheese and cabbage.
9. Top each with 1/2 tablespoon sour cream. Serve with lime wedges, if desired.
